findings.title: Unprotected functions
findings.description: Several external or public functions lack proper validation or restriction, potentially exploitable by attackers.

findings.title: Reentrancy risk in `transfer` and `transferFrom`
findings.description: Improper implementation of these functions can lead to reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Lack of access control
findings.description: Some functions lack proper access control mechanisms, allowing unauthorized users to perform certain actions.

findings.title: Complexity of contract logic
findings.description: The implementation has complex logic for fee management, liquidity pools, and token transfers, increasing the risk of security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Airdrop function allows the owner to airdrop tokens to specified wallets
findings.description: Elevated impact on smart contractâ€™s safety and security due to active smart contract owner privileges.

findings.title: Max Transaction % can be changed by the owner
findings.description: No threshold set, allowing the owner to change the value to 'zero'.
